definition: to put on an attitude/to pose
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: The brotherhood of man on earth will be possible only on a base of kitsch .
sentences.chinese: 地球上人的博愛將只可能以媚俗作態爲基礎。

sentences.english: This is something you can figure out for yourself, but you are being coy .
sentences.chinese: 這是你自己就可以弄清楚的東西，但你是在忸怩作態。

sentences.english: Make no mistake, Microsoft isn't playing coy in the smartphone market any longer.
sentences.chinese: 別搞錯，微軟不再在智能手機市場上忸怩作態了。

sentences.english: What I hate is the way he's always rubbing his hand together, "Washing his hands with invisible soap and imperceptible water."
sentences.chinese: 我看不慣的是他那總是忸怩作態地搓手的樣子。

sentences.english: Learn moderation in everything, and try not to be hypocritical.
sentences.chinese: 學習在任何事情都得中庸，並且試着別惺惺作態。

sentences.english: I don't know. - Don't be so coy , dear.
sentences.chinese: 這是你自己就可以弄清楚的東西，但你是在忸怩作態。

definition: (of a person) sad beyond words (idiom)/(of music, literature etc) poignant/very sentimental
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
lit. hiding the moon, shaming the flowers (idiom)/fig. female beauty exceeding even that of the natural world
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
